text: Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom
author: Søren Kierkegaard

text: Anxiety is love's greatest killer. It makes others feel as you might when a drowning man holds on to you. You want to save him, but you know he will strangle you with his panic
author: Anais Nin

text: Worrying is carrying tomorrow's load with today's strength- carrying two days at once. It is moving into tomorrow ahead of time. Worrying doesn't empty tomorrow of its sorrow, it empties today of its strength
author: Corrie Ten Boom

text: To hear the phrase (our only hope) always makes one anxious, because it means that if the only hope doesn't work, there is nothing left
author: Lemony Snicket

text: If you want to conquer the anxiety of life, live in the moment, live in the breath
author: Amit Ray

text: It did what all ads are supposed to do: create an anxiety relievable by purchase
author: David Foster Wallace

text: Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems
author: Epictetus

text: Don’t worry if people think you’re crazy. You are crazy. You have that kind of intoxicating insanity that lets other people dream outside of the lines and become who they’re destined to be
author: Jennifer Elisabeth

text: The more you pray, the less you'll panic. The more you worship, the less you worry. You'll feel more patient and less pressured
author: Rick Warren

text: Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths
author: C. H. Spurgeon

text: To venture causes anxiety, but not to venture is to lose one's self.... And to venture in the highest is precisely to be conscious of one's self
author: Søren Kierkegaard

text: Life is ten percent what you experience and ninety percent how you respond to it
author: Dorothy M. Neddermeyer

text: Do not let your difficulties fill you with anxiety, after all it is only in the darkest nights that stars shine more brightly
author: Ali Ibn Abi Talib AS

text: If you trade your authenticity for safety, you may experience the following: anxiety, depression, eating disorders, addiction, rage, blame, resentment, and inexplicable grief
author: Brené Brown

text: I want to be the best version of myself for anyone who is going to someday walk into my life and need someone to love them beyond reason
author: Jennifer Elisabeth

text: I've spent most of my life and most of my friendships holding my breath and hoping that when people get close enough they won't leave, and fearing that it's a matter of time before they figure me out and go
author: Shauna Niequist

text: Anxiety's like a rocking chair. It gives you something to do, but it doesn't get you very far
author: Jodi Picoult

text: It’s OKAY to be scared. Being scared means you’re about to do something really, really brave
author: Mandy Hale

text: The punishment of every disordered mind is its own disorder
author: St. Augustine of Hippo

text: Anxiety was born in the very same moment as mankind. And since we will never be able to master it, we will have to learn to live with it—just as we have learned to live with storms
author: Paulo Coelho

text: Even if she be not harmed, her heart may fail her in so much and so many horrors; and hereafter she may suffer--both in waking, from her nerves, and in sleep, from her dreams
author: Bram Stoker

text: The past could always be annihilated. Regret, denial, or forgetfulness could do that. But the future was inevitable
author: Oscar Wilde

text: I met a boy whose eyes showed me that the past, present and future were all the same thing
author: Jennifer Elisabeth

text: The largest part of what we call 'personality' is determined by how we've opted to defend ourselves against anxiety and sadness
author: Alain de Botton

text: I can do this… I can start over. I can save my own life and I’m never going to be alone as long as I have stars to wish on and people to still love
author: Jennifer Elisabeth

text: I do not sleep because I am not only afraid of the monsters at my door, but also of the monsters my own mind can conjure. The ones that live within
author: Samantha Shannon

text: Self-observation is the first step of inner unfolding
author: Amit Ray

text: If I could drown in sleep as I drown in fear I would be no longer alive
author: Franz Kafka

text: As you enter, you pray to leave. As you leave, you pray to never return
author: Victoria Aveyard

text: The pleasure of living and the pleasure of the orgasm are identical. Extreme orgasm anxiety forms the basis of the general fear of life
author: Wilhelm Reich

text: I promise you nothing is as chaotic as it seems. Nothing is worth diminishing your health. Nothing is worth poisoning yourself into stress, anxiety, and fear
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Maybe we tried to leave as much memories of ourselves with each other because we knew one day we wouldn't be together any more
author: Makoto Shinkai

text: Creating is living doubly. The groping, anxious quest of a Proust, his meticulous collecting of flowers, of wallpapers, and of anxieties, signifies nothing else
author: Albert Camus

text: Her forehead was a maze of anxious little grooves, from a lifetime of wondering about whether everyone within range was OK
author: Tana French

text: You always say such lovely things to me, Red. Do you say them to yourself?
author: Talia Hibbert

text: No event is depressing. I may feel depressed; if so, I take responsibility
author: Larry Godwin

text: The soul is torn apart in a painful condition as long as it prefers the eternal because of its Truth but does not discard the temporal because of familiarity
author: St. Augustine of Hippo

text: Care keeps his watch in every old man’s eye, And where care lodges, sleep will never lie
author: William Shakespeare

text: in my experience, the words “now just calm down” almost inevitably have the opposite effect on the person you are speaking to
author: Elyn R. Saks

text: Temperamentally anxious people can have a hard time staying motivated, period, because their intense focus on their worries distracts them from their goals
author: Winifred Gallagher

text: Our anxiety does not come from thinking about the future, but from wanting to control it
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: I wondered what you'd have on the side with a plate of Deep Fried Anxiety. Pickles? Coleslaw? Potato-strychnine mash?
author: Robin McKinley

text: I had the chance to make every possible mistake and figure out a way to recover from it. Once you realize there is life after mistakes, you gain a self-confidence that never goes away
author: Bob Schieffer

text: I hope you see what you've done to me
author: Matthew Little

text: I wanted to just sink into my media downloads for a while and pretend I didn't exist
author: Martha Wells

text: Alcohol has its own well-know defects as a medication for depression but no one has ever suggested - ask any doctor - that it is not the most effective anti-anxiety agent yet known
author: Joan Didion

text: Our stresses, anxieties, pains, and problems arise because we do not see the world, others, or even ourselves as worthy of love
author: Prem Prakash

text: I have panicked unnecessarily in all four corners of the globe
author: Jon Ronson

text: When your past shows up to haunt you, make sure it comes after supper so it doesn't ruin your whole day
author: Jay Wickre

text: She was terrified of everything, and terrified to show it
author: David Foster Wallace

text: You are the biggest enemy of your own sleep
author: Pawan Mishra

text: Present fears are less than horrible imaginings
author: William Shakespeare

text: Now that your worry has proved such an unlucrative business, Why not find a better job?
author: Hafez

text: Truces may stop the battles, but part of you will always feel like you're at war
author: David Levithan

text: Keep your problems to yourself, if its too much for you, kill it slowly till it disappears from your life
author: Michael Bassey Johnson

text: He felt like normal. Filled with anxiety, dread, sure. But even that wasn't unusual...
author: John Ajvide Lindqvist

text: Thanks to the imagination, there’s no end to things in this world that can trigger anxiety
author: Ryū Murakami

text: Just a glance at the ragged mess around her fingernails communicated more than the lenghiest essays on the nature of distress
author: Mark Z. Danielewski

text: Each moment of worry, anxiety or stress represents lack of faith in miracles, for they never cease
author: T.F. Hodge

text: Usually she ordered a cup of coffee and a cup of tea, as well as a brownie, propping up her sadness with chocolate and caffeine so that it became an anxiety
author: Lorrie Moore

text: Men seek rest in a struggle against difficulties; and when they have conquered these, rest becomes insufferable
author: Blaise Pascal

text: A lady should never feel anxious about her behavior. The status is bred in the bone. To show anxiety is to lower oneself. Anxiety is vulgar
author: Eloisa James

text: Though it may feel otherwise, enjoying life is no more dangerous than apprehending it with continuous anxiety and gloom
author: Alain de Botton

text: The mind that constantly wanders through the past is always a terrible mess
author: Marwane Caber

text: My experience is that many things are not as bad as I thought they would be
author: Mary Doria Russell

text: Anxiety is the handmaiden of contemporary ambition
author: Alain de Botton

text: I think this is what we all want to hear: that we are not alone in hitting the bottom, and that it is possible to come out of that place courageous, beautiful, and strong
author: Anna White

text: While writing is like a joyful release, editing is a prison where the bars are my former intentions and the abusive warden my own neuroticism
author: Tiffany Madison

text: How does one kill fear, I wonder? How do you shoot a spectre through the heart, slash off its spectral head, take it by its spectral throat?
author: Joseph Conrad

text: We live only a few conscious decades, and we fret ourselves enough for several lifetimes
author: Christopher Hitchens

text: It is our work to cast care, and it is God's work to take care
author: Thomas Watson

text: You are not alone...please know that hope can fly in on the most unexpected of wings
author: Tracy Shawn

text: Everything in us presses toward decision, even toward the wrong decision, just to be free of the anxiety that precedes any big step in life
author: May Sarton

text: I feel like I'm the one made out of paper
author: Akemi Dawn Bowman

text: Free time is death to the anxious, and thank goodness I don't have any of it right now
author: Jon Stewart

text: Sometimes feeling good isn’t about picking up more things to do, but about letting go of things that have nothing to do with you
author: Curtis Tyrone Jones

text: Everyone must imagine his own snakes because no one else's snakes can ever be as awful
author: Tove Jansson

text: The antidote to joy is dread
author: Sam Hamm

text: It ain't no use putting up your umbrella till it rains!
author: Alice Caldwell Rice

text: Just as anxiety can feed on itself, so can courage
author: John J. Ratey

text: You have every cause for anxiety. We are on the threshold of a more searching, more honest, more open society
author: László Krasznahorkai

text: Depression and anxiety are not feelings. Feelings return me to myself. Depression and anxiety are body snatchers that suck me out of myself so that I appear to be there but I'm really gone
author: Glennon Doyle

text: All this wondering was the weather vane on top of the building of unrest and of discontent
author: steinbeck

text: He was agitated for some reason that he could not name
author: Kate DiCamillo

text: I watch worry and anxiety being pandered to through technology which is neutral
author: Brian Richardson

text: You'd be surprised how easy it is to talk an anxiously attached person down from their spiral if you don't leave them in silence to imagine the worst
author: Sophie Gonzales

text: Lies do not console us, but only produce anxiety and dread
author: Marty Rubin

text: it's society's stigma that traumatizes people and causes anxiety, depression and suicide
author: Marty Rubin

text: He closes his eyes. A jungle in there, inside his head. He opens them quickly
author: Judith Guest

text: The slow ceiling fan sliced the thick, frightened air into an unending spiral that spun slowly to the floor like the peeled skin of an endless potato
author: Arundhati Roy

text: I has such a sinking in my inside I has to get up and eat biscuits
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

text: An anxious mind makes lions of tumble weeds
author: Stacey Lee

text: Become a master ignorer
author: Maxime Lagacé

text: Consuming caffeine gives us a taste of insanity
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

text: When frustration kills creativity, anxiety, anger and fear are born
author: Sukant Ratnakar

text: I wanted to talk, to say something, to ask questions. But I couldn't. All the words were stuck in my throat
author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz

text: Just as we throw out our garbage, we need to cast out thoughts that are trashy
author: Patsy Clairmont

text: Afterall, With great imagination comes great fear
author: Ashish Saha

text: The instinct towards panic, once experienced, cannot be unlearned
author: Gregory Maguire

text: Lies do not console us, but only produce dread and anxiety
author: Marty Rubin

text: My characters award me a forgiveness I've yet to accept
author: Nathaniel Connors

text: With every goal, wish, or plan we deem important, we invite anxiety
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

text: No need to hurry. No need to sparkle. No need to be anybody but oneself
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Stress is an ignorant state. It believes that everything is an emergency. Nothing is that important
author: Natalie Goldberg

text: I just give myself permission to suck…I find this hugely liberating
author: John Green

text: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will
author: Epictetus

text: Anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strength
author: Charles Spurgeon

text: How much pain have cost us the evils which have never happened
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: We must have a pie. Stress cannot exist in the presence of a pie
author: David Mamet

text: Anxiety is a thin stream of fear trickling through the mind. If encouraged, it cuts a channel into which all other thoughts are drained
author: Arthur Somers Roche

text: Nothing diminishes anxiety faster than action
author: Walter Anderson

text: Just when the caterpillar thought the world was ending, he turned into a butterfly
author: unknown

text: Nothing in the affairs of men is worthy of great anxiety
author: Plato

text: You cannot always control what goes on outside, but you can always control what goes on inside
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer
author: William S. Burroughs

text: Not everything that weighs you down is yours to carry
author: unknown

text: Do what you can, with what you’ve got, where you are
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Anxiety’s like a rocking chair. It gives you something to do, but it doesn’t get you very far
author: Jodi Picoult

text: Life is ten percent what you experience and ninety percent how you respond to it.
author: unknown

text: Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future
author: Deepak Chopra

text: Feelings come and go like clouds in a windy sky. Conscious breathing is my anchor
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: You don’t have to control your thoughts; you just have to stop letting them control you
author: Dan Millman

text: People become attached to their burdens sometimes more than the burdens are attached to them
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: It’s not time to worry yet
author: Harper Lee

text: If you can’t fly, run. If you can’t run, walk. If you can’t walk, crawl, but by all means, keep moving
author: Martin Luther King, Jr

text: Almost everything will work again if you unplug it for a few minutes, including you
author: Anne Lamott

text: My anxiety doesn’t come from thinking about the future but from wanting to control it
author: Hugh Prather

text: If you don’t like something, change it. If you can’t change it, change your attitude.
author: Maya Angelou

text: The way you tell your story to yourself matters
author: Amy Cuddy

text: Worry often gives a small thing a big shadow
author: Swedish proverb

text: Your calm mind is the ultimate weapon against your challenges
author: Bryant McGill

text: A positive attitude gives you power over your circumstances instead of your circumstances having power over you
author: Joyce Meyer

text: It’s not stress that kills us, it is our reaction to it
author: Hans Selye

text: Nothing can bring you peace but yourself
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The great thing, then, in all education, is to make our nervous system our ally instead of our enemy
author: William James

text: Tension is who you think you should be. Relaxation is who you are.
author: Chinese proverb

text: The time to relax is when you don’t have time for it
author: Sydney J. Harris

text: When you feel overwhelmed, remember: A little at a time is how it gets done. One thing, one task, one moment at a time
author: unknown

text: Surrender to what is, let go of what was, and have faith in what will be
author: Sonia Ricotti

text: Calm mind brings inner strength and self-confidence, so that’s very important for good health
author: Dalai Lama

text: You wouldn’t worry so much about what others think of you if you realized how seldom they do
author: Attributed to Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Present fears are less than horrible imaginings
author: William Shakespeare

text: You have dug your soul out of the dark, you have fought to be here; do not go back to what buried you
author: Bianca Sparacino

text: Everyone remembers the remark of the old man at the point of death, that his life had been full of troubles — most of which had never happened
author: Winston Churchill

text: Rule number one: Don’t sweat the small stuff. Rule number two: It’s all small stuff
author: Robert S. Eliot

text: Whatever happens to you belongs to you. Make it yours. Feed it to yourself even if it feels impossible to swallow. Let it nurture you because it will
author: Cheryl Strayed

text: We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop
author: Mother Teresa

text: Sometimes letting things go is an act of far greater power than defending or hanging on
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: The elimination diet: Remove anger, regret, resentment, guilt, blame and worry. Then watch your health, and life, improve
author: Charles Glassman

text: The universe doesn’t allow perfection
author: Stephen Hawking
